metadata.title: CVE-2021-3826 on Ubuntu 23.04 (lunar) - low
metadata.description:
Heap/stack buffer overflow in the dlang_lname function in d-demangle.c inlibiberty allows attackers to potentially cause a denial of service(segmentation fault and crash) via a crafted mangled symbol.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-3826` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cpp-12 - 12.2.0-17ubuntu1
g++-12 - 12.2.0-17ubuntu1

criterions.comment: gcc-11 package in lunar is affected and needs fixing.
gcc-12 package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '12.2.0-17ubuntu1').
gcc-13 package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '13-20230320-1ubuntu1').
gdb package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '13.1-2ubuntu2').
binutils package in lunar, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2.39-3ubuntu1').
